us.phonetic: /dɪˈskrɪməˌneɪt/, (v. di skrim′ə nāt′; adj. di skrim′ə nit)

example.eg: It's hard to discriminate between the individual cells.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 区别, 区分, 辨别

example.eg: It's hard to discriminate this flower from its close relative.
Everyone is welcome here; we never discriminate.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 有区别地对待, 歧视, 偏袒

example.eg: It is illegal to discriminate against someone because of his or her age.
The referee seems to be discriminating in favor of the home team.
